req.title: Technical Writer
req.description:
Since 1919, Halliburton has been opening Worlds of Opportunity around the globe. We're one of the world's largest and most safety-conscious providers of oil field services. Come in and explore your future!

Junior technical writer for software programs, specifically database programs. Writer is responsible for: * writing online help, installation guides, users guides, and release notes in FrameMaker to be formatted into PDF documents explaining how software applications programs work * writing detailed instructions on steps for procedures needed to perform tasks * developing workflows to show customers how to quickly and easily work in the software application. program * working with the development and testing teams to learn functionality * developing and updating hardcopy training documents * other duties as assigned Job requirements * 0-2 years of experience * Education - Either * B.A, in English with computer science experience (computer courses or writing for computer company) or * B.S. in Computer science with good technical writing skills * Experience with RoboHelp, HTML help, Framemaker, Linux, or databases or any geoscience field is a plus.

Halliburton: Worlds of Opportunity for you!

http://halliburton.contacthr.com/18282275

req.title: Health and Wellness Benefits Manager
req.description:
Texas Health Resources, one of the largest faith-based nonprofit health care delivery systems in the United States, has an immediate need for a Health and Wellness Benefits Manager. The Health and Wellness Benefits Manager position is a single-incumbent role reporting to the Administrative Director, Benefits and Total Health of Texas Health Resources. This individual will function as a system leader overseeing the administration of health and welfare benefits as well as wellness and health promotion programs to ensure integration and alignment of benefits designed to strengthen and advance the systemness of Texas Health Resources. The incumbent has primary responsibility for the administration of health and wellness benefit programs including claims processing and billing as well as administration of benefits enrollment, vendor management and issue resolution. Also participates in the overall planning of THR's health and wellness benefit plans. It is the role of this incumbent to ensure the system stays in compliance with plan documents and complies with State and Federal laws and system policies related to health and welfare benefits. Basic Qualifications: * Minimum of five years experience in administration of health and welfare benefit plans as well health promotion programs in large, national or regional HR Operations that are similar in size and complexity to Texas Health R3sources * A bachelor's degree is required, preferably in Human Resources * A formal certification in Human Resources such as a SPHR, PHR, CBP, CEBS or other designation is preferred * Excellent project management skills and experience with vendor management * Knowledge of and ability to apply state, federal benefit regulations * MS Office, PeopleSoft and data management skills necessary to perform analysis of programs * Strong managerial skills * Must be Proactive and continually look for ways to improve * Strong personal values systems compatible with Texas Health Resources. The core values—respect, integrity, compassion, excellence—rooted in this faith based legacy continue to influence the Texas Health culture, and the incumbents will seek to continue this as a unifying factor in strengthening our system culture * Must be a 'true system thinker' who has successfully embraced and deployed transformational best practices across a large, matrixed and complex system * The ability to educate on benefits, provide alternatives and think outside the box. * The incumbent must possess truly outstanding communication skills, able to influence both with and without authority, and be able to relate to a wide variety of stakeholders and constituents by adapting interpersonal styles as needed To view this exciting opportunity, please visit: http://tinyurl.com/4rxua8h At Texas Health Resources, we pride ourselves on providing eligible employees with a variety of great benefits which include: * Matching 401 (K) plan, Flex Spending Accounts and a Credit Union * Tuition reimbursement for eligible employees * Wellness and Career Development Programs * Competitive compensation packages including relocation coach * Medical, dental and vision insurance for eligible employees * Life, AD&D and Long Term Care Insurance and Disability Coverage * Adoption Assistance, On-site Child Care and Fitness Centers Texas Health Resources has 12 acute-care hospitals and one long-term care hospital that total 3,355 licensed hospital beds, employs more than 18,000 people, and counts more than 3,600 physicians with active staff privileges at its hospitals. Texas Health Resources is one of the largest faith-based, nonprofit health care delivery systems in the United States and the largest in North Texas in terms of patients served. The system's primary service area consists of 16 counties in north central Texas, home to more than 6.2 million people. Texas Health Resources is an equal opportunity employer that values and celebrates diversity at all levels of our organization. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V

http://texashealthresources.contacthr.com/18271714

req.title: Manager, Hyperion Data Relationship Management and Master Data Management S
req.description:
JOB SUMMARY This role serves as the Security Administrator supporting global implementations of Hyperion EPM and Master Data Management for a top company in the Hospitality industry. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS * 10+ Years Enterprise Application Security Experience PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS * Four-year degree in a technical or financial discipline * Experience with the IBM Rational toolset * Six Sigma certification (green belt)

A WORLD OF OPPORTUNITIES Hilton Worldwide offers a variety of global opportunities within our portfolio of world renowned brands. With more than 3,200 hotels in 77 countries, our Team Members are committed to delivering our brand promises to our customers. At Hilton, you'll discover hospitality jobs whether you are a first time applicant or a career professional. Our portfolio consists of well known brands representing market leadership in their respective segments of the industry, whether it's luxury or lifestyle brands to mid prices, extended stay or vacation ownership, Hilton has something for everyone. The company owns, manages and franchises hotel brands including The Waldorf Astoria Hotels and Resorts®, Conrad Hotels and Resorts®, Hilton®, Doubletree®, Embassy®, Hilton Garden Inn®, Hampton, Homewood Suites®, Home2Suites by Hilton®, and Hilton Grand Vacations® Come and explore a world of opportunities and join our dynamic team to help us achieve our mission to be the preeminent global hospitality company - the first choice of guests, team members and owners alike. PROUD PART OF HILTON WORLDWIDE Hilton Worldwide's Headquarters is located in McLean, Virginia. The company owns, manages and franchises some of the best known and highly regarded hotel brands around the world. We offer competitive benefits to our Team Members. We invite you to become part of a dynamic team whose vision is to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality. EOE/AA

http://hilton.contacthr.com/18268500

req.title: Sr. Human Resources Generalist
req.description:
ArvinMeritor, Inc. is a premier global supplier of a broad range of integrated systems, modules and components to original equipment manufacturers and the aftermarket for the transportation and industrial sectors. The company serves commercial truck, trailer and specialty original equipment manufacturers and certain aftermarkets, and light vehicle manufacturers. ArvinMeritor marked its centennial anniversary in 2009, celebrating a long history of 'forward thinking.' ArvinMeritor common stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol ARM. For important information about the company, visit www.arvinmeritor.com.

OVERVIEW

Implements and supports human resource activities at the York site including employee relations, attendance management, recruiting, record retention, TS 16949 compliance and coordinating all site communication efforts.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Support all plant floor employee relations activities including hourly staffing, handbook compliance and interpretations and employee corrective action.

  • Maintain employee records as well as Affirmative Action submissions, unemployment responses, local STD claims and site insurance benefit plans, ensuring that employees and the company obligations are met.

  • Manage site hourly compensation program ensuring accuracy

  • Implement site attendance management program to achieve all site attendance measurables.

  • Coordinate with state and federal agencies to obtain available training or hiring support funding.

  • Lead employee engagement programs (e.g., York Site Appreciation Team, York Employee Newsletter) to improve communication and ensure recognition of employee and company achievements.

  • Promote company programs to ensure that employees take full advantage of ARM opportunities including E-check ups, 401K education, retirement planning and other learning opportunities.

  • Support HR's compliance with TS 16949 requirements

  • Support site Lean efforts by updating all plant lean measures per cadence schedule.

  • Represent ArvinMeritor at community-related activities.

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Promotes Core Values - Integrity * Builds Team Orientation

  • Emphasizes Customer Focus - Drives for Improvement * Creates Change - Flexibility and Adaptability

  • Promotes Organizational Learning

TECHNICAL/PROFESSIONAL KNOWLEDGE

  • Demonstrated capability and knowledge of Microsoft Office (i.e. Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint).

  • Experience with PeopleSoft or other HRIS system preferred.

EDUCATION

  • Four-year college degree in Business Administration or Human Resources related discipline.

  • Masters degree In Human Resources or Business Administration preferred

EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING:

  • 4 - 8 years experience as an HR generalist

  • Experience in a manufacturing environment is preferred.

 

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

  • Off shift coverage may be required.

  • Willingness to relocate to other North American locations as needed.

ArvinMeritor, Inc. offers a stimulating, high-tech work environment backed by an excellent salary and benefits package. For immediate consideration, visit us on the Web at www.arvinmeritor.com/workwithus and apply on-line.

 

Employment agencies that do not have specific approval to recruit for ArvinMeritor, Inc. should not forward resumes to ArvinMeritor, Inc.

 

ArvinMeritor will not be held responsible for any fees and/or expenses based on any submission and subsequent use of resumes unless the employment agency has been contacted by ArvinMeritor to assist in the recruitment for that specific position.

 

ArvinMeritor is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

http://arvinmeritor.contacthr.com/18255278

 *2 years Labor & Delivery and obstetrics experience required. *Pool non-eligible, 7p-7a, varied days, one weekend per month.  FL RN license, BLS, ACLS, NRP required.  Fetal monitoring certificate preferred. Must have excellent customer service skills.  

Thank you for your interest in Broward Health. Broward Health is an EO/AA procurer of goods/services, M/F/D/V.

req.title: Training Specialist (CONTRACT POSITION)
req.description:
A health care company with global reach. A product pipeline filled to the brim. A team committed to scientific advancement.
Think what's possible.
A global healthcare leader, Novartis has one of the most exciting product pipelines in the industry today. A pipeline of innovative medicines brought to life by diverse, talented, performance driven people. ll of which makes us one of the most rewarding employers in our field.

Job Description:

Think what's possible! Novartis and its associated companies are always looking for talented employees globally. We are engaged in advance preparation for potential position openings. Submit your CV/resume now to join our talent pool for the position described below. Please note that you are not applying for a current vacancy, but are submitting your CV/resume for consideration for future, possible opportunities. We look forward to receiving your information. Novartis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Training Specialist - Contract Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research is looking for a Training Specialist who would provide value through design of curriculum for the T&OD Departments training needs; additional responsibilities may include training facilitation and management of training programs (team workshops, lunch n' learn sessions, and training workshops of various lengths). This is a contract position. Major Accountabilities Include: Develop training materials and facilitator guides based on defined company needs and materials built to date (examples of topics includes Team Charters, decision making, stakeholder management, conflict management, creative problem solving, matrix team leadership) Develop training materials and facilitator guides for T&OD curriculum Facilitate Team Excellence training workshops for intact teams and open enrollment audience Facilitate training workshops Manage strategy and logistics around program delivery - registration, venues, onsite needs, etc. for both types of workshops Background Education : MBA or Masters in OD, HR, Human Development, Industrial Psychology, Instructional Design Experience: at least 7 years of Industry Experience; experience with instructional design and stand-up training

Minimum Requirements:

Background Education : MBA or Masters in OD, HR, Human Development, Industrial Psychology, Instructional Design Experience: at least 7 years of Industry Experience; experience with instructional design and stand-up training

To learn about other Novartis opportunities, Click here

http://novartis.contacthr.com/18245257

req.title: Pharmacy TechnicianCedars-Sinai Beverly Hills, CA 90211 Cedars-Sinai Medic
req.description:
Cedars-Sinai Beverly Hills, CA 90211 Cedars-Sinai Medical Care Foundation, an affiliate of Cedars-Sinai Medical Group and a division of the world-class Cedar-Sinai Health System has an exciting career opportunity for a Pharmacy Technician. We are physician directed and committed to providing high quality healthcare in a growing multi-specialty medical group and IPA setting.

The Pharmacy Technician will be responsible for assisting the Director, Pharmacy Services in the implementation and maintenance of the Pharmacy Refill Center in the Medical Network. The primary focus of the position is to process refill requests by following medication specific protocols on behalf of the CSMG primary care physicians and other physicians as directed. All duties are performed independently by the technician under the supervision of a pharmacist.

Qualifications: -Candidates must have a High School Diploma and be registered as a Pharmacy Technician with the California Board of Pharmacy. - Two years experience as a Pharmacy Technician in a retail pharmacy. - Must be able to travel and possess reliable transportation inclusive of a current, valid California Drivers' License and automobile insurance (collision and casualty). -Excellent verbal and written communication skills. -Basic computer skills in Microsoft Windows (word, excel, power point, and outlook). -Understanding of medical terminology. -Must be able to do calculations involving ratios, proportions, and percentages.

Join Cedars-Sinai and begin a fulfilling career with a respected leader in healthcare. Interested candidates must create a profile by logging into: https://www.cedars-sinaimedicaldeliverynetwork.apply2jobs.com/ Click on Login to create your profile. Apply to Job# 5499.

https://www.cedars-sinaimedicaldeliverynetwork.apply2jobs.com/

req.title: IT Administrator I
req.description:
Building a career at Granite, may be the most valuable thing you could do...
Since 1922 Granite Construction has built some of America's largest infrastructure projects; highways, bridges, dams, rail, power and other 'heavy civil' projects.  Additionally, many of our offices provide high quality concrete, asphalt and gravel products for the construction industry.  At Granite, we believe that our greatest asset is our people. We build careers by encouraging creativity and providing opportunities for development.  Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability and Citizenship.   Are we right for you, are you right for us?  Why not find out!!



General Summary

 

This position is responsible for providing ongoing local network support for the local business unit including the main office, plants, satellite offices, and job site locations to ensure workforce efficiency and productivity.  Depending on location assist in the management, supervision or provides direct guidance and direction to IT staff.  Manage the activities associated with providing technical services to internal customers by identifying, prioritizing, and confirming resolution of reported problems with desktop, laptop, and networked systems. Ensure that all phases of desktop support, including installations, upgrades, software, hardware, operating systems, and operating system configuration issues, are properly coordinated, monitored, tracked, and resolved.  Supports and maintains effective relationships with end users, local business management, and Corporate IT Staff. Develops information technology projects and provides strategic management and objectives for the business unit.  Follows standard operating procedures and customer service guidelines relating to IT support.  Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of IT functions.

 

Essential Job Accountabilities

 

1.     Resolve local network and communication issues to maintain operational readiness.

2.     Maintain and support local Cisco VoIP telephones and related equipment.

3.     Assist in the maintenance of the local Active Directory OU, installation and configuration of local network applications, servers, file shares, network services and associated objects in accordance with company policies and procedures.

4.     Assist in the development and maintenance of business unit IT documentation to enable consistent standards and operating procedures.

5.     Assist in the testing of the local Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity plans to ensure minimal downtime in the event of a disaster.

6.     Assist in coordinating the acquisition, installation, configuration, and maintenance of IT equipment in compliance with corporate standards.

7.     Assist in the maintenance of hardware inventory, licensing and asset rotation consistent with company policies and procedures.

8.     Assist with the design, installation, requirement gathering, and maintenance of IT resources for acquisitions, large projects and joint ventures to ensure compliance with corporate standards.

9.     Support business applications to ensure compliance with corporate standards.

10.  Assist Business Unit management in determining future IT needs at the location, enterprise initiatives, budgets, forecasts, licensing and asset rotation to ensure profitability and alignment with Company goals and objectives.

11.  Maintain open communication with Group IT Manager and local Business Manager to ensure effective problem resolution and establishment of priorities.  

12.  Assist in the supervision of the job performance of business unit or region IT employees and/or consultants including exercising discretion in evaluating job performance and determining appropriate corrective action, analyze work flow, establish priorities, and delegate tasks in order to meet deadlines

Education

 

*         Associates degree or equivalent combination of training, experience and certifications.

*         CompTIA A+.

*         Microsoft Certified Professional preferred.

*         CompTIA Network+ preferred.

 

Work Experience

 

*         Minimum 4 years relevant experience in network and PC support for a multi-site business environment.

*         0 to 1 year experience supervising or managing IT personnel.

*         Familiarity with cost accounting, budgeting, and forecasting.

 

Knowledge, skills, and abilities

 

*         Uses professional concepts; applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.

*         Works on problems of moderate to advanced scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.

*         Normally receives minimal instruction on routine work, General instruction on new projects or assignments.

*         Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Windows XP Professional.

*         Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows 2003 Server and Microsoft Active Directory.

*         Working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite.

*         Working knowledge of HP servers, workstations, and storage products.

*         Basic knowledge of Cisco Internetworking products.

*         Basic knowledge of Cisco Unified Communications.

*         Working knowledge of HP servers, workstations, and storage products.

*         Ability to convey technical concepts and ideas to non-technical personnel.

*         Excellent organizational skills.

*         Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills

*         Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

 

Physical Demands

 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

Additional Requirements/Skills

 

*         Ability to abide by Granite's Code of Conduct on a daily basis.

*         Commitment to conduct Business unit IT operations in a manner consistent with Corporate IT policies, procedures and standards.

*         Practical knowledge of standard business practices.

*         Ability to work with minimum daily supervision.

*         Ability to work both collaboratively as a team player and independently as required.

*         Demonstrate a high degree of patience with an ability to work with all levels of management and staff.

*         Ability to learn new technologies and systems quickly.

*         Demonstrate strong time management skills and consistent follow through.

*         Ability to prioritize workload, especially under pressure.

*         Travel to plants, satellite offices and job sites may be frequent with some extended daily and weekend hours required.

About Granite Construction Incorporated
Granite Construction Incorporated is a member of the S&P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers.

Granite Construction is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace.

http://granite.contacthr.com/18243085

req.title: Consultant Support Representative
req.description:
Thirty-One is the #1 direct-selling brand of exclusive on-trend, stylish and practical handbags, fashion accessories, totes, and organization solutions and faithfully delivers the most personally and professionally rewarding direct-selling Consultant and Customer experience in the world.  We are a faith-based company whose culture celebrates, encourages, and rewards its employees. We believe that if someone is satisfied and successful at work, they will be satisfied and successful in other areas of their life.  Our goal is to help all employees achieve personal and professional success and that they feel part of a family and part of something special.

Responsible for Building the Consultant Experience.  Under limited supervision, deliver effective execution of service and marketing strategies, and provide administrative support to consultants.

Percent of Time Spent

Essential Duties/Tasks/Responsibilities

 

 

100%

  • Deliver consistently excellent customer service over the phone and in writing.
  • Support consultants through back-office administration, client administration, and marketing support.
  • Document all interactions with customers and prospects to improve internal communication and program execution.
  • Navigate multiple systems and apply customer service and direct sales expertise in order to provide accurate and timely delivery of Thirty-One products.
  • Consistently meet established standards for productivity and quality in inbound, outbound, email, and returns support to Thirty-One consultants and their clients.

 

This position may be required to execute special projects or other related duties based upon the needs of the organization and department.

            Experience:

·   Three or more years of experience in customer service and/or direct sales

·   One year of experience in call center

·   Experience working in a team environment preferred

            

Working Environment

·         General office environment

·         Stressful situations will occur occasionally

·         No travel required

Thirty-One Gifts is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

http://thirtyonegifts.com/careerstest.htm?jobid=2249449
